key_points: Darnella Frazier was awarded a special Pulitzer citation for her cellphone recording of George Floyd's murder.
Her video played a significant role in sparking global protests against racial injustice and police brutality.
Frazier was 17 years old at the time she recorded the incident on May 25, 2020.
Her testimony at Derek Chauvin's trial provided crucial context to the events leading to Floyd's death.
Former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin was convicted of second-degree unintentional murder, third-degree murder, and manslaughter.
The Star Tribune of Minneapolis won the Pulitzer for breaking news reporting on Floyd's murder and its aftermath.
Roy Peter Clark from the Poynter Institute praised Frazier's video for its profound impact on social justice.
The special citation Frazier received acknowledges exceptional work outside of usual Pulitzer categories.
Frazier also received the PEN/Benenson Courage Award from PEN America for changing the course of history.
